info.title: AgentAuri API
info.description:
Real-time backend infrastructure for monitoring and reacting to ERC-8004 on-chain agent economy events.

## Authentication

The API supports a 3-layer authentication system:

- **Layer 0 (Anonymous)**: IP-based rate limiting (10 calls/hour)
- **Layer 1 (API Key)**: Account-based access with `X-API-Key` header
- **Layer 2 (JWT)**: Full user access with `Authorization: Bearer <token>`

## Rate Limiting

All endpoints are rate limited. Check response headers for quota information:
- `X-RateLimit-Limit`: Maximum requests per hour
- `X-RateLimit-Remaining`: Remaining requests
- `X-RateLimit-Reset`: Unix timestamp when limit resets

get.description:
Returns the Agent Card with system metadata and capabilities.
This is a public endpoint used for API discovery.

Returns security contact information following RFC 9116.
This is a public endpoint used by security researchers.

# RFC 9116 Compliance

Required fields:
- Contact: Security contact email or URL
- Expires: Expiration date for the security.txt file

Optional fields:
- Acknowledgments: URL to hall of fame page
- Preferred-Languages: Preferred languages for communication
- Canonical: Canonical URL for the security.txt file
- Policy: URL to vulnerability disclosure policy
- Hiring: URL to security job openings

post.summary: Exchange OAuth authorization code for tokens
post.description:
This endpoint is used by the frontend to exchange a temporary authorization code
(received from OAuth callback) for JWT access and refresh tokens.
The code is single-use and expires after 5 minutes.

429.description: Rate limit exceeded (max 10 requests per minute per IP)

get.description:
Redirects the user to GitHub's OAuth consent screen.
After authorization, GitHub redirects to /api/v1/auth/github/callback

Exchanges the authorization code for tokens, fetches the user profile,
and creates/logs in the user. Redirects to frontend with JWT token.

302.description: Redirect to frontend with JWT token

get.description:
Redirects the user to Google's OAuth consent screen.
After authorization, Google redirects to /api/v1/auth/google/callback

Exchanges the authorization code for tokens, fetches the user profile,
and creates/logs in the user. Redirects to frontend with JWT token.

302.description: Redirect to frontend with JWT token

post.summary: Login with username/email and password
post.description:
Authenticates a user and returns a JWT token.
Implements account lockout for brute-force protection.

400.description: Validation error or no password set

429.description: Account locked due to too many failed attempts

post.summary: Logout and clear authentication cookie

get.summary: Get current authenticated user's session info
get.description: Returns the user profile with linked wallets, providers, and organizations.

post.summary: Generate a nonce for SIWE wallet authentication
post.description:
Returns a nonce and challenge message for wallet signature verification.
The wallet address is required to generate a proper SIWE message.

post.summary: Refresh access token using a refresh token
post.description:
Exchanges a valid refresh token for a new access token and refresh token.
Implements token rotation: the old refresh token is invalidated.

post.summary: Register a new user
post.description:
Creates a new user account with username, email, and password.
Also creates a personal organization for the user.

post.summary: Login with wallet using SIWE (Sign-In With Ethereum)
post.description:
Verifies an EIP-191 signed message and returns a JWT token.
Creates a new user if this is the first login with this wallet.

post.summary: Purchase credits via Stripe Checkout

POST /api/v1/billing/credits/purchase

Creates a Stripe Checkout session for credit purchase.
Returns checkout URL for client redirect.

get.summary: Get subscription details for an organization
get.description: GET /api/v1/billing/subscription?organization_id=xxx

get.summary: List credit transactions for an organization
get.description: GET /api/v1/billing/transactions?organization_id=xxx&limit=20&offset=0

post.summary: Handle Stripe webhook events
post.description:
POST /api/v1/billing/webhook

Verifies webhook signature and processes events:
- checkout.session.completed: Add credits
- checkout.session.async_payment_failed: Log failure
- customer.subscription.created/updated/deleted: Update subscription

# Security

1. Validates source IP against Stripe's known webhook IPs (configurable)
2. Verifies webhook signature cryptographically
